page.title: 06BASILDON NE: NEWCOMER'S VIEW
page.content: I have lived here for five months and I go to the local junior school. I like living here, but the problem is my family live in London. The town centre is very good and the open-air market is cheap and helpful. There are plenty of open spaces for me to enjoy although many are vandalised. I think the idea of having the industrial area on the outskirts of the town is a good one. I think there should be more activities for children and teenagers. The council is good. When my parents complain they always come to see what the trouble is. My parents find they must buy all their shopping in the town because the small local shops are expensive. My dad says it is wrong to put up the fees in the car park, but apart from that, we think Basildon a good place to live.
